metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000487 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Plexus-utils before 3.0.16 is vulnerable to command injection because it does not correctly process the contents of double quoted strings. It was discoverd that Plexus-utils incorrectly handled double quoted strings, An attacker could use this for command injection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplexus-utils-java - 1:1.5.15-4+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libplexus-utils2-java - 2.0.5-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: plexus-utils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.5.15-4+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
plexus-utils2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.5-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
